content.text:
I understand. I'm ready to explore the codebase and design implementation plans in read-only mode.

To warm up, let me get a quick overview of the project structure:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Bash">
<parameter name="command">find /home/aiscend/work/fortune_ai -type f -name "*.py" | head -30 && echo "---" && ls -la /home/aiscend/work/fortune_ai/</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

I now have a good overview of the Fortune AI project structure:

- **api/**: FastAPI routes (auth, bento, chat, dashboard, goals, push, reflection, social, user)
- **common/**: Shared utilities (config, LLM client, logging, prompts, a2ui)
- **services/**: Business logic (bazi, currency, goal, growth, jitai, push, reflection, social, twin, etc.)
- **stores/**: Data persistence (fortune_db)
- **migrations/**: SQL migrations
- **web-app/**: Frontend application
- **docs/**: Architecture and design documentation
- **scripts/**: Utility scripts (e2e tests, seed data, etc.)

I'm ready to receive requirements and design implementation plans. What would you like me to explore and plan?
